title: Build Error - libclog - "relocation R_X86_64_32 against `.rodata.str1.1' can not be used when making a shared object"
body_html:
Issue description

Getting an error when trying to compile the latest version of PyTorch, with "recipe for target 'lib/libcaffe2.so' failed". More precisely, getting the following error:

/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/libclog.a(clog.c.o): relocation R_X86_64_32 against `.rodata.str1.1' can not be used when making a shared object; recompile with -fPIC
../lib/libclog.a: error adding symbols: Bad value

Code example

> cd pytorch
> git pull --recurse-submodules
> python setup.py install
...
[ 43%] Built target sleef
[ 43%] Linking CXX static library ../../../../../../lib/libtbb_static.a
[ 47%] Built target tbb_static
[ 47%] Linking CXX shared library ../lib/libcaffe2.so
/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/libclog.a(clog.c.o): relocation R_X86_64_32 against `.rodata.str1.1' can not be used when making a shared object; recompile with -fPIC
../lib/libclog.a: error adding symbols: Bad value
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2.dir/build.make:3773: recipe for target 'lib/libcaffe2.so' failed
make[2]: *** [lib/libcaffe2.so] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:1015: recipe for target 'caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:138: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2
Failed to run 'bash tools/build_pytorch_libs.sh --with-cuda --with-nnpack --with-mkldnn nccl caffe2 nanopb libshm gloo THD'

System Info

  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS

  • GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.4) 5.4.0 20160609

  • CMake version: version 3.6.3

  • Python version: 3.6

  • Is CUDA available: Could not collect

  • CUDA runtime version: Cuda compilation tools, release 9.0, V9.0.176 (obtained through nvcc --version

  • GPU models and configuration:

  • GPU 0: TITAN X (Pascal)

  • GPU 1: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti

  • GPU 2: TITAN X (Pascal)

  • GPU 3: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti

  • Nvidia driver version: 390.42

  • cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:

    • /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.5.1.10
    • /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.0.5
    • /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn_static_v5.a
    • /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn_static_v7.a
    • /usr/local/cuda-8.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so
    • /usr/local/cuda-8.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.5
    • /usr/local/cuda-8.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.5.1.10
    • /usr/local/cuda-8.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.5.1.5
    • /usr/local/cuda-8.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn_static.a
    • /usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcudnn.so.7.1.2
    • /usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcudnn_static.a

  • Versions of relevant libraries:

    • [pip3] numpy (1.14.0)
    • [conda] cuda80 1.0 0 soumith
    • [conda] magma-cuda80 2.3.0 1 pytorch
    • [conda] magma-cuda90 2.3.0 1 pytorch
    • [conda] torch 0.4.0a0+a3d08de
    • [conda] torchfile 0.1.0

body:
## Issue description

Getting an error when trying to compile the latest version of PyTorch, with `"recipe for target 'lib/libcaffe2.so' failed"`. More precisely, getting the following error:
> /usr/bin/ld: ../lib/libclog.a(clog.c.o): relocation R_X86_64_32 against `.rodata.str1.1' can not be used when making a shared object; recompile with -fPIC
> ../lib/libclog.a: error adding symbols: Bad value


## Code example

```
> cd pytorch
> git pull --recurse-submodules
> python setup.py install
...
[ 43%] Built target sleef
[ 43%] Linking CXX static library ../../../../../../lib/libtbb_static.a
[ 47%] Built target tbb_static
[ 47%] Linking CXX shared library ../lib/libcaffe2.so
/usr/bin/ld: ../lib/libclog.a(clog.c.o): relocation R_X86_64_32 against `.rodata.str1.1' can not be used when making a shared object; recompile with -fPIC
../lib/libclog.a: error adding symbols: Bad value
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2.dir/build.make:3773: recipe for target 'lib/libcaffe2.so' failed
make[2]: *** [lib/libcaffe2.so] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:1015: recipe for target 'caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [caffe2/CMakeFiles/caffe2.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:138: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2
Failed to run 'bash tools/build_pytorch_libs.sh --with-cuda --with-nnpack --with-mkldnn nccl caffe2 nanopb libshm gloo THD'
```


## System Info

- OS: Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS
- GCC version: (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.4) 5.4.0 20160609
- CMake version: version 3.6.3

- Python version: 3.6
- Is CUDA available: Could not collect
- CUDA runtime version: Cuda compilation tools, release 9.0, V9.0.176 (obtained through `nvcc --version`

- GPU models and configuration:
- GPU 0: TITAN X (Pascal)
- GPU 1: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
- GPU 2: TITAN X (Pascal)
- GPU 3: GeForce GTX 1080 Ti
 
- Nvidia driver version: 390.42
- cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
    - /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.5.1.10
    - /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7.0.5
    - /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn_static_v5.a
    - /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn_static_v7.a
    - /usr/local/cuda-8.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so
    - /usr/local/cuda-8.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.5
    - /usr/local/cuda-8.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.5.1.10
    - /usr/local/cuda-8.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn.so.5.1.5
    - /usr/local/cuda-8.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudnn_static.a
    - /usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcudnn.so.7.1.2
    - /usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcudnn_static.a

- Versions of relevant libraries:
    - [pip3] numpy (1.14.0)
    - [conda] cuda80                    1.0                           0    soumith
    - [conda] magma-cuda80              2.3.0                         1    pytorch
    - [conda] magma-cuda90              2.3.0                         1    pytorch
    - [conda] torch                     0.4.0a0+a3d08de           <pip>
    - [conda] torchfile                 0.1.0                     <pip>
